Resource.title: ARK: Server API
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

[B][U]SafeZones[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins/tree/master/SafeZone']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Prevent PVP in certain area's
[*]Prevent Building in certain area's
[*]Prevent Structure damage in certain area's
[*]Notifications on Entering and Leaving SafeZone area's
[*]Ability to restrict players from joining/leaving area
[*]Ability to give items in SafeZone's
[*]Change spawn point
[*]Configuration reloading
[*]Supports Permissions Plugin
[*]Visual bubble to mark safe zones
[*]Override map spawn points to your own ones
[*][B]Can enable PvP in certain zones even in PvE servers![/B]
[/LIST]
[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: ARK: Server API
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

[B][U]SafeZones[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins/tree/master/SafeZone']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Prevent PVP in certain area's
[*]Prevent Building in certain area's
[*]Prevent Structure damage in certain area's
[*]Notifications on Entering and Leaving SafeZone area's
[*]Ability to restrict players from joining/leaving area
[*]Ability to give items in SafeZone's
[*]Change spawn point
[*]Configuration reloading
[*]Supports Permissions Plugin
[*]Visual bubble to mark safe zones
[*]Override map spawn points to your own ones
[*][B]Can enable PvP in certain zones even in PvE servers![/B]
[/LIST]
[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: ARK: Server API
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

[B][U]SafeZones[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins/tree/master/SafeZone']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Prevent PVP in certain area's
[*]Prevent Building in certain area's
[*]Prevent Structure damage in certain area's
[*]Notifications on Entering and Leaving SafeZone area's
[*]Ability to restrict players from joining/leaving area
[*]Ability to give items in SafeZone's
[*]Change spawn point
[*]Configuration reloading
[*]Supports Permissions Plugin
[*]Visual bubble to mark safe zones
[*]Override map spawn points to your own ones
[*][B]Can enable PvP in certain zones even in PvE servers![/B]
[/LIST]
[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: ARK: Server API
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

[B][U]SafeZones[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins/tree/master/SafeZone']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Prevent PVP in certain area's
[*]Prevent Building in certain area's
[*]Prevent Structure damage in certain area's
[*]Notifications on Entering and Leaving SafeZone area's
[*]Ability to restrict players from joining/leaving area
[*]Ability to give items in SafeZone's
[*]Change spawn point
[*]Configuration reloading
[*]Supports Permissions Plugin
[*]Visual bubble to mark safe zones
[*]Override map spawn points to your own ones
[*][B]Can enable PvP in certain zones even in PvE servers![/B]
[/LIST]
[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: ARK: Server API
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

[B][U]SafeZones[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins/tree/master/SafeZone']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Prevent PVP in certain area's
[*]Prevent Building in certain area's
[*]Prevent Structure damage in certain area's
[*]Notifications on Entering and Leaving SafeZone area's
[*]Ability to restrict players from joining/leaving area
[*]Ability to give items in SafeZone's
[*]Change spawn point
[*]Configuration reloading
[*]Supports Permissions Plugin
[*]Visual bubble to mark safe zones
[*]Override map spawn points to your own ones
[*][B]Can enable PvP in certain zones even in PvE servers![/B]
[/LIST]
[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZEnterSettings [B]<ZoneName> <PreventEntering> <PreventLeaving> [/B]- Changes safezone enter settings. [B]PreventEntering [/B]and [B]PreventLeaving [/B]can be either 1 or 0.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZCreateZone [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
[B][U]RCON Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]SZGiveItems [B]<ZoneName>[/B] - Gives items from config to all players in this zone.
[*]SZReloadConfig - Reloads config.json.
[*]SZShowSpawnPoints - It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]
Useful command to display your coordinates: [ICODE]ShowDebug physics[/ICODE] or [ICODE]ccc[/ICODE] (it will copy your current coords to clipboard)

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
Default config contains 2 zones as an example. You can create as many as you want.
[CODE=json]{
  "Name":"Zone1", // Safe zone name
  "Position":[ // Safe zone location
    -111820,
    233874,
    -14259.6
  ],
  "ForMap": "TheCenter" // Map name where the zone will be created, if empty or removed this option it will be spawned on all maps
  "Radius":1800, // Safe zone size
  "PreventPVP":true,
  "PreventStructureDamage":true,
  "PreventBuilding":true,
  "KillWildDinos":true, // Kills all wild dinos in safe zone
  "PreventLeaving":false, // Prevents players from leaving safe zone
  "PreventEntering":false, // Prevents players from entering safe zone
  "EnableEvents":true, // Options like PreventLeaving, PreventEntering, Notification require this to be enabled
  "ScreenNotifications":true, // Enables on-screen messages
  "ChatNotifications":true, // Enables chat messages
  "GiveDinosInCryopod": true, // If true, the dinos given will be in a cryopod
  "ShowBubble": true, // If true, a visual bubble will be spawned at zone, showing its radius
  "BubbleColor": [ 255, 0, 0 ], // RGB color of the visual bubble
  "SuccessNotificationColor":[
    0,
    1,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "FailNotificationColor":[
    1,
    0,
    0,
    1
  ],
  "Messages":[
    "You have entered {0}",
    "You have left {0}",
    "This is a Community trade center you can not build here",
    "You are not allowed to enter",
    "You are not allowed to leave"
  ],
  "ItemsConfig":{ // Items that player will receive if SZGiveItems command was used
    "Items":[
      {
        "Amount":1,
        "Quality":0,
        "ForceBlueprint":false,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'"
      }
    ],
    "Dinos":[
      {
        "Level":10,
        "Blueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/Dinos/Carno/Carno_Character_BP.Carno_Character_BP'",
        "SaddleBlueprint": "Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle' "
      }
    ]
},
"OverrideSpawnPoint": { // Chooses a random spawn point on given map and spawn zone name
    "TheCenter": {
      "Lava Island (Hard)": [
        [ -44742, -111102, -12645 ],
        [ -57239, -157787, -13490 ]
      ]
    }
  }
[/CODE]

[B]Permissions:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]SafeZones.[B]<Name>[/B] - Permissions to enter in the specific zone (if "PreventEntering" is enabled). Example: [ICODE]SafeZones.Zone1[/ICODE].
[/LIST]
[B]Dependencies:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][URL='https://arkserverapi.com/resources/permissions.12/']Permissions[/URL]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Private Message
Resource.message:
added Structure damage check
fixed pvp issues
fixed being spammed when farming with fists about pvp
fixed pvp messages now are sent to attacker instead of victim
added admin bypass to config to ignore the checks for admins
changed server messages to chat messages
added safezone names to messages
added more customiseable messages including colours
added basic support for getting items with a command in certain area's, I plan on adding limit's eventually
added items config
Possible Unicode support

Resource.title: Admins Permissions
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]Updated internal logic so it doesn't lag when checking zone events
[*]Improved enter/leave preventions and teleport locations when they are not allowed to enter/leave
[*]Added various config options:
[*]     [B]"GiveDinosInCryopod": true[/B], - If true when the command `SZGiveItems` is executed, it will give the dinos in cryopod
[*]     [B]"ShowBubble": false[/B], - If true a bubble like tek forcefield will appear around the zone
[*]     [B]"BubbleColor": [ 1, 0, 0 ][/B], - Color of the zone's bubble, values from 0-1. Example for yellow: [1, 1, 0]
[*]     [B]"SaddleBlueprint": ""[/B] - Saddle of the dino (only given if it's spawned in cryopods)
[*]     [B]"ForMap"[/B] - Input map name where the zone should be created. Allows to use same config for multiple maps
[*]Reworked override spawn point config, it now allows to set different spawn locations based on spawn zone name
[*]Added command: `SZShowSpawnPoints` (Console/RCON). It will show the name of the spawn points for getting correct config values for the override spawn feature
[/LIST]

New commands:

[RCON] SZGiveItems - Command is now usable via RCON
[Console] SZCreateZone <zone name>` - Creates a zone in the player's position and adds it to config (only name and position, all other options are false by default)
[RCON] SZReloadConfig - Command is now usable by RCON

- Notes:
     - Plugin should support live loading and unloading
     - On config reload/live load all zones get re-created so the config changes are correctly applied

Support:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/VvKXbkdHBQ[/URL]

Resource.title: Game Config Manager
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]Prevented grappling players inside the safe zone if prevent pvp is true
[*]Added new option to allow PvP in PvE servers, for this to work you just need "PreventPvP": false
[*]Added a new config option for zones. This option will teleport the player/dino who enters the zone to the specified coords X Y Z
[*]Changed how config is read to prevent crashing if an option is missing
[/LIST]

Config changes needed!

[CODE=json]"TeleportOnEnterZone":{
        "Enabled": true,
        "TeleportToDestination": [ 35232.5, -13253.1, -15230 ]
      },[/CODE]

Resource.title: Ping Limiter
Resource.message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://discord.gg/hDP7ghz[/URL]
[B][U]Dino Colour Command[/U][/B]

Automatically color a dinosaur by a command like a command in admin manager but you can do it by chat command and also by editing config.json you can allow players to use the command and configure permissions.

[B]News![/B] Now you can use color names from [URL]https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs[/URL]
For example: [B]/sdc 0 DarkRed[/B] (Just do without spaces!)
also, you can use region names For example: [B]/sdc Body 25[/B]
And combined: [B]/sdc Body Dark[/B]
[U]All this works for /cdc as well[/U]

[B]Region Name List:[/B]
   Body = 0
   Face = 1
   Side = 2
   Legs = 3
   Top  = 4
   Under = 5

[B]Commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]/sdc [B]<Region> <Colour>[/B]
[*]/cdc [B]<DinoName>[/B] [B]<Region> <Colour>[/B]
[*]/dcc.reload - chat reload command
[*]cheat dcc.reload - console reload command
[*]dcc.reload - rcon reload command
[/LIST]
Regions: [URL='https://ark.gamepedia.com/Pteranodon#Color_Scheme_and_Regions']Click Here For Pteranodon Regions.[/URL]
Colors: [URL='https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs']Click Here For Colours.[/URL]

[B][U]Example[/U][/B]
/sdc 1 1 - This will set a dinosaur region 1 to red.
/cdc MyDinoName 1 1 - Sets specified dinos region 1 to red.

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
[CODE=json]
{
  "General": {
    "RequireAdmin": false,
    "Permission": {
      "Enable": true,
      "Name": "DinoColourCommand"
    },
    "TokenBank": {
      "Enable": false,
      "Cost": 3,
      "Type": "DinoColourCommand"
    }
  },
  "Messages": {
    "NoPermission": {
      "Message": "You don't have permissions to use this command",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "NotEnoughTokens": {
      "Message": "You don't have enough Tokens to use this command",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectSyntax_CDC": {
      "Message": "Incorrect Syntax: /cdc <Name> <Region> <Colour>",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectSyntax_SDC": {
      "Message": "Incorrect Syntax: /sdc <Region> <Colour>",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectColours": {
      "Message": "Dino Colour must be 1 - 100 | 201-226 OR Red, Blue, Yellow, DarkRed. You find more colors at https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectRegion": {
      "Message": "Dino Region must be 0-5 or Body, Face, Side, Legs, Top or Under.",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectTeam": {
      "Message": "That is not your dinosaur!",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectTargeting": {
      "Message": "Please face the middle of your screen towards the dino you want to color!",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "Confirmation": {
      "Message": "{} Color updated!",
      "Colors": [ 0, 255, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    }
  }
}
[/CODE]

[B][U]Permissions:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]DinoColorCommand - Optional can also be changed, see config.
[/LIST]
[B]Token Bank Integration:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]This plugin support Token Bank integration
[/LIST]

[B][U][B]All Creds to[/B] Ownprox who created the plugin initially. [/U][/B]
Old Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

[*]/sdc [B]<Region> <Colour>[/B]
[*]/cdc [B]<DinoName>[/B] [B]<Region> <Colour>[/B]
[*]/dcc.reload - chat reload command
[*]cheat dcc.reload - console reload command
[*]dcc.reload - rcon reload command
[/LIST]
Regions: [URL='https://ark.gamepedia.com/Pteranodon#Color_Scheme_and_Regions']Click Here For Pteranodon Regions.[/URL]
Colors: [URL='https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs']Click Here For Colours.[/URL]

[B][U]Example[/U][/B]
/sdc 1 1 - This will set a dinosaur region 1 to red.
/cdc MyDinoName 1 1 - Sets specified dinos region 1 to red.

[U][B]Config:[/B][/U]
[CODE=json]
{
  "General": {
    "RequireAdmin": false,
    "Permission": {
      "Enable": true,
      "Name": "DinoColourCommand"
    },
    "TokenBank": {
      "Enable": false,
      "Cost": 3,
      "Type": "DinoColourCommand"
    }
  },
  "Messages": {
    "NoPermission": {
      "Message": "You don't have permissions to use this command",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "NotEnoughTokens": {
      "Message": "You don't have enough Tokens to use this command",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectSyntax_CDC": {
      "Message": "Incorrect Syntax: /cdc <Name> <Region> <Colour>",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectSyntax_SDC": {
      "Message": "Incorrect Syntax: /sdc <Region> <Colour>",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectColours": {
      "Message": "Dino Colour must be 1 - 100 | 201-226 OR Red, Blue, Yellow, DarkRed. You find more colors at https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectRegion": {
      "Message": "Dino Region must be 0-5 or Body, Face, Side, Legs, Top or Under.",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectTeam": {
      "Message": "That is not your dinosaur!",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "IncorrectTargeting": {
      "Message": "Please face the middle of your screen towards the dino you want to color!",
      "Colors": [ 255, 0, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    },
    "Confirmation": {
      "Message": "{} Color updated!",
      "Colors": [ 0, 255, 0 ],
      "DisplayTime": 10,
      "DisplayScale": 0.5
    }
  }
}
[/CODE]

[B][U]Permissions:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]DinoColorCommand - Optional can also be changed, see config.
[/LIST]
[B]Token Bank Integration:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]This plugin support Token Bank integration
[/LIST]

[B][U][B]All Creds to[/B] Ownprox who created the plugin initially. [/U][/B]
Old Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

Resource.title: Structures Limit
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*][B]Fixed:[/B] Crash scenarios when using /sdc
[*][B]New:[/B] Now you can use color names from: [URL]https://ark.gamepedia.com/Color_IDs[/URL]  For example: /sdc 0 DarkRed (Just do without spaces!)
[*][B]New: [/B]Now you can use region names For example: /sdc Body 25
[LIST]
[*][U]Full list:[/U]
Body = 0
Face = 1
Side = 2
Legs = 3
Top = 4
Under = 5
[/LIST]
[*][B]New:[/B] Token bank Integration Preparation (Optional!)
[*][B]New:[/B] Customizable Permission Name
[*][B]New:[/B] Customizable Message System to fit your language.
[*][B]Added:[/B] /dcc.reload - chat reload command
[*][B]Added:[/B] cheat dcc.reload - console reload command
[*][B]Added:[/B] dcc.reload - rcon reload command

[B]Note: This update requires config update!!
 Second Note:[/B] You can still use the old system for example /sdc 0 25 or you can combine it after your liking's for example /sdc 0 Red or /sdc Body 25 or use both new functions /sdc Body Red :) (This also ofc works for the other command /cdc)
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Lottery
Resource.message:
[CENTER][ATTACH type="full" alt="style-logoq.png"]127[/ATTACH][/CENTER]
[B][U]Ark Server API[/U]

Product Description[/B]: This tool allows you to load plugins into your gaming communities; this is an open-source community-supported "[B]API[/B]" required for server admins to load server plugins and resources correctly.
 
[B]Requirements[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]The API will only work on: Windows 7 and above or Windows Server 2008 and above operating systems.
[*]You need to install "[B]Microsoft Visual C++ 2019 Redistributable Package[/B]" for the API to load correctly.
[/LIST]

[B]Video instruction:[/B] [MEDIA=youtube]O45hJKGNHXQ[/MEDIA]

[B]ServerAPI Wiki[/B]: [URL]https://arkserverapi.wiki/[/URL]

[B]API Installation Steps[/B]:
[LIST=1]
[*]Download the resource by clicking the "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/resources/ark-server-api.12/download'][B][U]Download[/U][/B][/URL]" button.
[*]Unzip the contents of the "[B].ZIP[/B]" file into "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64[/B]"
[*]You can now start your ark survival evolved game server.
[/LIST]

[B]Plugin Installation Steps[/B]:
[LIST=1]
[*]Find a plugin you want to download inside the website's "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/resources/'][B]Resources[/B][/URL]" section.
[*]Unzip the contents of the "[B].ZIP[/B]" file into "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins[/B]"
[*]You may now edit the "[B].JSON[/B]" files located inside the plugin folder you just installed, or you may now start the server.
[/LIST]

[B]Product Notes[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]The API will generate log files in this location "[B]ShooterGame/Win64/logs/ArkApi.log[/B]"
[*]The API has built-in crash logs, which can be located inside "[B]ShooterGame/Saved/Logs/[/B]"
[*]The API has no connection or affiliation with "[B]Wildcard Studios[/B]" directly, nor should it ever be considered that "[B]Wildcard Studios[/B]" endorses the API. The API is an open-source tool the community can use to run plugins for their video game servers, similar to how "[B]Minecraft / Rust[/B]" and other video games have plugin systems where you can improve the overall health and gameplay of your community servers.
[*]Please note when installing plugins into the "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins[/B]" folder, you must make sure the "[B].DLL[/B]" plugin name matches the same "folder" name. Changing the folder name to something different or unique will prevent the "[B].DLL[/B]" from reading the folder and preventing it from starting.
[*]You may join our "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/pages/discord/'][B][U]discord server[/U][/B][/URL]" if you have any questions/feedback or want general support regarding ArkServerAPI.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Lottery
Resource.message:
[CENTER][ATTACH type="full" alt="style-logoq.png"]127[/ATTACH][/CENTER]
[B][U]Ark Server API[/U]

Product Description[/B]: This tool allows you to load plugins into your gaming communities; this is an open-source community-supported "[B]API[/B]" required for server admins to load server plugins and resources correctly.
 
[B]Requirements[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]The API will only work on: Windows 7 and above or Windows Server 2008 and above operating systems.
[*]You need to install "[B]Microsoft Visual C++ 2019 Redistributable Package[/B]" for the API to load correctly.
[/LIST]

[B]Video instruction:[/B] [MEDIA=youtube]O45hJKGNHXQ[/MEDIA]

[B]ServerAPI Wiki[/B]: [URL]https://arkserverapi.wiki/[/URL]

[B]API Installation Steps[/B]:
[LIST=1]
[*]Download the resource by clicking the "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/resources/ark-server-api.12/download'][B][U]Download[/U][/B][/URL]" button.
[*]Unzip the contents of the "[B].ZIP[/B]" file into "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64[/B]"
[*]You can now start your ark survival evolved game server.
[/LIST]

[B]Plugin Installation Steps[/B]:
[LIST=1]
[*]Find a plugin you want to download inside the website's "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/resources/'][B]Resources[/B][/URL]" section.
[*]Unzip the contents of the "[B].ZIP[/B]" file into "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins[/B]"
[*]You may now edit the "[B].JSON[/B]" files located inside the plugin folder you just installed, or you may now start the server.
[/LIST]

[B]Product Notes[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]The API will generate log files in this location "[B]ShooterGame/Win64/logs/ArkApi.log[/B]"
[*]The API has built-in crash logs, which can be located inside "[B]ShooterGame/Saved/Logs/[/B]"
[*]The API has no connection or affiliation with "[B]Wildcard Studios[/B]" directly, nor should it ever be considered that "[B]Wildcard Studios[/B]" endorses the API. The API is an open-source tool the community can use to run plugins for their video game servers, similar to how "[B]Minecraft / Rust[/B]" and other video games have plugin systems where you can improve the overall health and gameplay of your community servers.
[*]Please note when installing plugins into the "[B]ARK\ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins[/B]" folder, you must make sure the "[B].DLL[/B]" plugin name matches the same "folder" name. Changing the folder name to something different or unique will prevent the "[B].DLL[/B]" from reading the folder and preventing it from starting.
[*]You may join our "[URL='https://gameservershub.com/forums/pages/discord/'][B][U]discord server[/U][/B][/URL]" if you have any questions/feedback or want general support regarding ArkServerAPI.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Teleport
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]Updated Permissions plugin bundled with Ark Api
[*]Introuduced a new HTTP requests library, faster than the old one (Big thanks to WETBATMAN!)
[*]Added a new crash prevention for Tick/Timer callbacks, it will now output the callback name in order to make debugging of the issue easier (Big thanks to Lethal!)
[*]Added new tools for plugin developers
[*]Prevented some crashes when game classes or functions were not correctly dumped in a PdbConfig.json. All classes and functions are now dumped by default.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Clean Up
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]Updated PDB Reader to fix crashes brought by latest ark versions (deflate, addler, compress crashes, etc...).
[*]Startup time is slightly faster now
[*]Removed Tick/Timer crash prevention due to some issues that could be derived from allowing corrupt program state after preventing a crash.
[*]Removed most config options that are no longer needed (/Win64 config.json file).
[*]Fixed auto plugin reload config read, it won't be ignored now.
[/LIST]

[B]Notes for developers[/B]

[LIST]
[*]Due to PDB Reader update some overloaded functions will just have 1 overload available. API now reads the first available overload.
[*]For the above reason one of the affected classes is `FName`. Headers have been updated and plugins using FNames **must be recompiled** against these updated headers. Old FNames won't crash, but they will have the wrong string passed on and features might not work as expected.
[*]Any overloaded function could have been affected, if you find any overload that does not work anymore, let us know and we will update the headers, or you can make a pull request to the GitHub repository.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Discord Integrator
Resource.message:
Plugin adds timed chat messages and welcome message.

You can choose from 3 different modes for every message:
[LIST]
[*]ClientChat  - Chat message
[*]ServerChat - Server chat message
[*]Notification - On-screen message
[/LIST]
[B]Configuration:
[SPOILER="Config"][/SPOILER][/B][SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]{
  "AdvertMessages":{
    "WelcomeMsgEnabled":true, // Enable welcome message, true or false
    "WelcomeMsg":"Welcome to my server!",
    "WelcomeMsgColor":[ // Welcome message color in normalized RGBA format
      1.0,
      0,
      0,
      1.0
    ],
    "Interval":120, // Interval in seconds between messages
    "Messages":[
      {
        "Message":"Message 1",
        "Type":"ServerChat",
        "Color":[
          1.0,
          1.0,
          1.0,
          0.8
        ]
      },
      {
        "Message":"Message 2",
        "Type":"ClientChat",
        "Color":[
          0,
          1.0,
          1.0,
          1.0
        ]
      },
      {
        "Message":"Message 3",
        "Type":"Notification",
        "Color":[
          1.0,
          1.0,
          1.0,
          0.8
        ],
        "DisplayScale":1.3, // Size of the message (only for notifications)
        "DisplayTime":5.0 // How long this message should be displayed (only for notifications)
      }
    ]
  }
}[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]
[B]Console commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Advert.Reload - Reloads config
[/LIST]
[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]
[*]Copy "ArkAdvert" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]
Source code: [URL]https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins[/URL]

    ]

Resource.title: LootBoxes Plus (Atlas)
Resource.message:
This plugin allows you to easily add new chat commands to your server. For example: /help, /site, /ts...

You can choose from 3 different modes for every command:
[LIST]
[*]ClientChat  - Usual chat message
[*]ServerChat - Server chat message
[*]Notification - On-screen message
[/LIST]
You can also change color and a few other settings for every message.

[B]Console commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]CustomChat.Reload - Reloads config
[/LIST]
[B]Configuration:[/B]
[SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]{
  "ChatCommands":[
    {
      "Command":"/help",
      "Type":"ClientChat",
      "Reply":"<RichColor Color=\"1, 0, 0, 1\">Available commands:</>\n/help\n/site\n/settings" // \n - is a new line. You can also use ArkML formatting
    },
    {
      "Command":"/site",
      "Type":"ServerChat",
      "Color":[ // Color in normalize RGBA format
        1.0,
        0,
        0,
        0.8
      ],
      "Reply":"www.site.com"
    },
    {
      "Command":"/settings",
      "Type":"Notification",
      "Color":[
        1.0,
        1.0,
        1.0,
        0.8
      ],
      "DisplayScale":1.3, // Size of the message (only for notifications)
      "DisplayTime":5.0, // How long this message should be displayed (only for notifications)
      "Reply":"Player max level - 100\nDino max level - 150"
    }
  ]
}[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]
[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]
[*]Copy "CustomChat" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]

Source code: [URL]https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins[/URL]

        1.0,
        0.8
      ],
      "DisplayScale":1.3, // Size of the message (only for notifications)
      "DisplayTime":5.0, // How long this message should be displayed (only for notifications)
      "Reply":"Player max level - 100\nDino max level - 150"
    }
  ]
}[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]
[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]

[/LIST]

Source code: [URL]https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins[/URL]

Resource.title: LootBoxes Plus (Atlas)
Resource.message:
This plugin allows you to easily add new chat commands to your server. For example: /help, /site, /ts...

You can choose from 3 different modes for every command:
[LIST]
[*]ClientChat  - Usual chat message
[*]ServerChat - Server chat message
[*]Notification - On-screen message
[/LIST]
You can also change color and a few other settings for every message.

[B]Console commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]CustomChat.Reload - Reloads config
[/LIST]
[B]Configuration:[/B]
[SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]{
  "ChatCommands":[
    {
      "Command":"/help",
      "Type":"ClientChat",
      "Reply":"<RichColor Color=\"1, 0, 0, 1\">Available commands:</>\n/help\n/site\n/settings" // \n - is a new line. You can also use ArkML formatting
    },
    {
      "Command":"/site",
      "Type":"ServerChat",
      "Color":[ // Color in normalize RGBA format
        1.0,
        0,
        0,
        0.8
      ],
      "Reply":"www.site.com"
    },
    {
      "Command":"/settings",
      "Type":"Notification",
      "Color":[
        1.0,
        1.0,
        1.0,
        0.8
      ],
      "DisplayScale":1.3, // Size of the message (only for notifications)
      "DisplayTime":5.0, // How long this message should be displayed (only for notifications)
      "Reply":"Player max level - 100\nDino max level - 150"
    }
  ]
}[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]
[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]
[*]Copy "CustomChat" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]

Source code: [URL]https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins[/URL]

Resource.title: AntiStructureDamage
Resource.message:
Small plugin for randomizing dino colors. There are a few mods that do same already but all of them share same problems, this plugin aims to solve them.

[B]Features:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]    Configurable colors (you can remove or add colors).
[*]    Does not remapping any of existing dinos. Therefore it's clean and won't add bugs. Removing this plugin won't remove tamed dinos as well.
[*]    Works for every dino and does not require update when the new dino is released.
[/LIST]
[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]
[*]Copy "DinoColors" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]
Source code: [URL]https://github.com/Michidu/Ark-Server-Plugins[/URL]

Resource.title: Advanced Kits
Resource.message:
[B][U]Teleport[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Teleport to offline players
[*]Player teleport request using /tpr
[*]TPR Cooldowns limits
[*]TPR Dino limits
[*]TPR Teleport Distance limits
[*]TPR Teleport Delay
[*]Admin Teleport to player
[*]Admin Teleport player to yourself
[*]Admin Teleport dinosaur looking at
[*]Admin Teleport tamed dinos within distance
[*]Admin Teleport other players tamed dinos within distance
[*]Admin Teleport to Position X, Y, Z
[*]Admin Position output
[*]Customise messages
[/LIST]

[B][U]Chat Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]/tpr <CharacterName>                           -     Request a teleport to a player
[*]/tpa                                                            -     Accept the teleport request from a player
[/LIST]

[B][U]Console Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]

[*]cheat offline <CharacterName>                      -     Admin lookup offline players
[*]cheat otp <ID>                                               -     Admin teleport to offline players
[*]cheat tp <CharacterName>                             -     Admin Teleport to a character
[*]cheat tpm <CharacterName>                         -      Admin Teleport character to you
[*]cheat tt                                                               -      Admin Teleport the dinosaur you are looking at to you (pretty close range)
[*]cheat tpd <Distance>                                       -      Admin Teleport all tribe tamed dinos to you <Distance> :   1 - 8000
[*]cheat tpdp <Distance> <CharacterName>   -      Admin Teleport a players tribe tamed dinos to you
[*]cheat tpp <X> <Y> <Z>                                     -      Admin Teleport to position
[*]cheat pos                                                           -       Admin output current position
[*]cheat treload                                                     -       Reload Teleport Config
[/LIST]
[B][U]Config:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]TPREnabled                                              -     Enable Player teleport requests: true or false value only
[*]TPRCoolDownEnabled                            -     Cooldown before player can tpr again
[*]TPRCoolDownForPlayerTeleportedTo -     Apply cooldown to player being teleported to
[*]TPRCoolDownSeconds                           -      How long cooldown lasts in seconds
[*]TPRDelaySeconds                                    -     The delay in seconds before a teleport requested player teleports
[*]TPRMaxDistance                                      -     The max distance a teleport request player can teleport apart from each other -1 to disable
[*]TPRAllowDinoTeleport                            -     Allow dinosaurs to teleport with teleport requested player this in no way effects admin commands
[*]Messages                                                   -     its ok to change these just make sure to leave all the {} in the string
[/LIST]

[B][U]Donate[/U][/B]
Any donation is much appreciated and very helpful towards the upkeep/creation of the plugins i provide, Plugins take time to create some hours some days and I keep 99% of them open source for others to learn from.

[URL='https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=J6NKDZVCH9RN4&source=url'][IMG]https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/GB/i/btn/btn_donateCC_LG.gif[/IMG][/URL]

Resource.title: Advanced Achievements
Resource.message: Better player name detection it will now select a player closes to the name typed, it helps with names such as shaco and shacore now you can type /tp sha and it will tele to shaco and if you type /tp shacore it will tp to shacore before it would teleport to which ever was the first person to login this has also been applied to other commands before this if shaco logged in last there would of  been no way to get to him as /tp shaco would teleport you to shacore.

[B]Original Author:[/B]
[USER=1]@Michidu[/USER]

[B]Maintainer:[/B]
[USER=8785]@Lethal[/USER] [USER=3052]@Pelayori[/USER] [USER=48]@Foppa[/USER] [USER=1942]@WETBATMAN[/USER] 

Default plugin for ArkApi that allows you to manage group permissions. It's mostly used by other plugins and controls which players have access to certain features.

Default groups are 'Admins' and 'Default'. You can't remove those groups but you can configure them. All players that connect to your server automatically join to 'Default' group. 'Admins' group has all permissions by default.
Moreover, all admins will be automatically added to the 'Admins' group.

[B]Console and Rcon commands:

Player Management: [/B]
[LIST]
[*]Permissions.Add [B]<SteamID>[/B] [B]<Group>[/B] - Adds player to a existing group permanently.
[*]Permissions.Remove [B]<SteamID> <Group>[/B] - Removes player from the group.
[*]Permissions.AddTimed [B]<SteamID>[/B] [B]<Group> <Hours> <DelayHours> [/B]- Adds player to a existing group time based.
[*]Permissions.RemoveTimed [B]<SteamID> <Group> [/B]- Removes player from the timed group.
[*]Permissions.PlayerGroups [B]<SteamID>[/B] - Lists all player's groups.
[/LIST]
[B]Tribe Management:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Permissions.AddTribe [B]<TribeID>[/B] [B]<Group>[/B] - Adds tribe to a existing group permanently.
[*]Permissions.RemoveTribe [B]<TribeID> <Group>[/B] - Removes tribe from the group.
[*]Permissions.AddTribeTimed [B]<TribeID>[/B] [B]<Group> <Hours> <DelayHours> [/B]- Adds tribe to a existing group time based.
[*]Permissions.RemoveTribeTimed [B]<TribeID> <Group> [/B]- Removes tribe from the timed group.
[*]Permissions.TribeGroups [B]<TribeID> [/B]- Lists all tribe's groups.
[/LIST]
[B]Group Management:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Permissions.AddGroup [B]<Group>[/B] - Adds a group.
[*]Permissions.RemoveGroup [B]<Group>[/B] - Removes the group.
[*]Permissions.Grant [B]<Group>[/B] [B]<Permission>[/B] - Grants a specific permission to the group. Wildcard character (*) would give all permissions to this group.
[*]Permissions.Revoke [B]<Group> <Permission> [/B]- Revokes a specific permission from the group.
[*]Permissions.GroupPermissions[B]<Group>[/B] - Lists all group's permissions.
[*]Permissions.ListGroups - Lists all groups and their permissions.
[/LIST]
[B]Chat commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]/groups - Lists player's groups.
[/LIST]
[B]Configuration:[/B]
[SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]{
  "Database":"sqlite", // DB type: sqlite or mysql.
  "MysqlHost":"localhost", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlUser":"root", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPass":"pass", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlDB":"arkdb", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPort":3306, // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPlayersTable":"ArkPPlayers", // MySQL players table name (optional)
  "MysqlGroupsTable":"ArkPGroups", // MySQL groups table name (optional)
  "MysqlTribesTable":"ArkPTribes", //MySQL tribes table name (optional)
  "DbPathOverride":"", // Path to the DB file, leave empty to use default path. Only for sqlite db.
  "ClusterSyncTime": 5 // Sync interval to refresh cached permissions values (optional)
}
[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]

More information about the plugin: [URL]https://wiki.arkserverapi.com/index.php?title=Permissions[/URL]

[B]Installation:[/B]
This plugin is installed in ArkApi by default. But if you need to update/reinstall it:
[LIST=1]
[*]Copy "Permissions" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]

[*]Permissions.Revoke [B]<Group> <Permission> [/B]- Revokes a specific permission from the group.
[*]Permissions.GroupPermissions[B]<Group>[/B] - Lists all group's permissions.
[*]Permissions.ListGroups - Lists all groups and their permissions.
[/LIST]
[B]Chat commands:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]/groups - Lists player's groups.
[/LIST]
[B]Configuration:[/B]
[SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]{
  "Database":"sqlite", // DB type: sqlite or mysql.
  "MysqlHost":"localhost", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlUser":"root", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPass":"pass", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlDB":"arkdb", // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPort":3306, // Only for mysql db.
  "MysqlPlayersTable":"ArkPPlayers", // MySQL players table name (optional)
  "MysqlGroupsTable":"ArkPGroups", // MySQL groups table name (optional)
  "MysqlTribesTable":"ArkPTribes", //MySQL tribes table name (optional)
  "DbPathOverride":"", // Path to the DB file, leave empty to use default path. Only for sqlite db.
  "ClusterSyncTime": 5 // Sync interval to refresh cached permissions values (optional)
}
[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]

More information about the plugin: [URL]https://wiki.arkserverapi.com/index.php?title=Permissions[/URL]

[B]Installation:[/B]
This plugin is installed in ArkApi by default. But if you need to update/reinstall it:
[LIST=1]
[*]Copy "Permissions" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Ark Help Menu
Resource.message:
[B][U]Mutes[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Mute Steam id or ip from global chat
[*]Mutes are saved and loaded
[*]Black list words and mute players with penalty if needed
[*]IP Ban naughty players
[*]Ability to tell a ip banned / muted player how long they are banned / muted for
[*]Get Ips
[*]List mutes / ip bans
[*]Configurable messages
[*]DB sync with all cluster using DBOverride set db path same for all servers.
[/LIST]

[U][B]Console / RCON Commands (remember if using in console add cheat infront):[/B][/U]
[LIST]
[*]listmutes                                                                 -     List all mutes / ip bans
[*]mute <Mins> <Hours> <CharacterName>           -     Mute a Character for a certain amount of minutes and hours
[*]ipban <Mins> <Hours> <CharacterName>          -     IP Ban a Character for a certain amount of minutes and hours and also kicks them from the server
[*]unmute <CharacterName>                                    -     UnMute a Character
[*]ipunban <CharacterName>                                   -     IP UnBan a Character
[*]getip <CharacterName>                                        -     Returns the players ip if no player name is given it returns yours.
[*]clearall                                                                    -     UnMute &IP UnBan Everybody
[*]mreload                                                                  -     Reload Config
[/LIST]

[B][U]Donate[/U][/B]
Any donation is much appreciated and very helpful towards the upkeep/creation of the plugins i provide, Plugins take time to create some hours some days and I keep 99% of them open source for others to learn from.

[URL='https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=J6NKDZVCH9RN4&source=url'][IMG]https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/GB/i/btn/btn_donateCC_LG.gif[/IMG][/URL]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Configuration:[/B][/HEADING]
[SPOILER="Config"]
[CODE=json]
{
 "Mysql": {
  "UseMysql": false,
  "MysqlHost": "localhost",
  "MysqlUser": "apitest",
  "MysqlPass": "12345",
  "MysqlDB": "apitest",
  "MysqlPort": 3306
 },

  "Discord": { //Used for discord Logging
   "Enabled": false,
   "SenderName": "ArkShop",

  },
  "TimedPointsReward": {

   "StackRewards": false, //If true player will receive the sum of all the rewards of the groups he's in.

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

 }
}
[/CODE]
[/SPOILER]

[B]Please note that once the server is launched, a file named "ArkShop.db" will be automatically generated in the plugins directory. This file stores all the crucial information regarding points and kits that you will need to manage as an administrator.[/B]
