Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.

[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: PVPVE
Resource.message:
[HEADING=1][B][U]Ark Survival Evolved: Shop, Currency & Kits[/U][/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2][URL='http://discord.gg/gsh'][B][U]Join our discord: discord.gg/gsh to learn more today![/U][/B][/URL][/HEADING]

[HEADING=2][B]Features:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*]Our ark shop offers an array of exciting features that can add depth and variety to your gameplay experience. With the ability to add any item, dinosaur, beacon, or experience points to your inventory, you can easily customize your gameplay experience to suit your preferences. Whether you're looking for a specific item to help you in your adventures or want to level up faster, our shop has got you covered.
[*]In addition to this, we have a points trading system that allows you to trade points with other players. This system makes it easy for you to obtain the items and dinosaurs you want without having to spend too much time or effort. You can also use this system to trade with other players for rare or hard-to-find items.
[*]Another exciting feature of our shop is the ability to create custom kits. These kits can contain any combination of items and dinosaurs that you desire. This feature is perfect for players who want to create their own unique playstyle or who want to try out new strategies.
[*]We understand the importance of rewarding our players for their dedication, which is why we have a points system that rewards players for the time they spend on the server. The more time you spend on our server, the more points you earn. This system is designed to encourage players to keep playing and to reward those who invest time and effort into our community.
[*]Our shop uses a SQLite or MySQL database to ensure that all your data is stored safely and securely. We also have a customizable configuration that allows you to tailor the shop to your specific needs. This means that you can customize the shop to suit your playstyle, preferences, and budget.
[*]Finally, we have an option to automatically give kits to players upon spawning. This feature ensures that players have the necessary tools and resources to get started on their adventures without having to manually give them kits every time they spawn.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=1][B]Chat Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[HEADING=2]Here are some helpful commands that you can use in the game:[/HEADING]

[LIST]
[*]To see your current points balance, type "[B]/points[/B]" in the chat.
[*]If you want to buy an item from the shop, use the command "[B]/buy <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to purchase.
[*]To send points to another player, type "[B]/trade <'CharacterName'> <Amount>[/B]". Remember to include the other player's character name in single quotes and the amount of points you want to send.
[*]If you want to see a list of all available kits, type "[B]/kit[/B]". To redeem a specific kit, type "[B]/kit <KitName>[/B]".
[*]To buy a kit that has a price, type "[B]/buykit <KitName> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <KitName> with the name of the kit you want to purchase and <Amount> with the quantity you want to buy.
[*]To see a list of all available items in the shop, type "[B]/shop <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]If you want to sell an item, use the command "[B]/sell <ID> <Amount>[/B]". Replace <ID> with the item's ID number and <Amount> with the quantity you want to sell.
[*]To see a list of all items available for selling, type "/[B]shopsell <Page>[/B]". Replace <Page> with the page number you want to view.
[*]Finally, if you need help with any of these commands, type "/[B]shophelp[/B]" to see a custom help message.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]Console Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to add points to a specific player identified by their SteamID.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command allows you to change the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - This command prints the current points amount of a player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases points from a player's current amount. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in points.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. The entered amount number can be negative, allowing for a decrease in kits.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload[/B] - Reloads a config file for ArkShop.
[*][B]ResetPoints [/B]- Resets the points of all players.
[*][B]ResetKits [/B]- Resets the kits of all players.
[*][B]ListInvItems[/B] - This command lists the blueprint paths of all items in the inventory to the log file.
[/LIST]

[HEADING=3][B]RCON Commands:[/B][/HEADING]
[LIST]
[*][B]AddPoints <SteamID> <Amount> [/B]- This command adds a specified amount of points to a player's account.
[*][B]GetPlayerPoints <SteamID>[/B] - By using this command, you can check the amount of points a player has.
[*][B]SetPoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command lets you set the points amount for a specific player.
[*][B]ChangePoints <SteamID> <Amount>[/B] - This command works the same way as the console command, allowing you to change a player's points amount.
[*][B]ChangeKitAmount <SteamID> <KitName> <Amount>[/B] - This command adds or decreases the number of kits a player has. You can enter a negative amount to decrease the kit count.
[*][B]ArkShop.Reload [/B]-This command is used to reload a configuration file.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Ghost Rider RP plugin
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]Added permissions support
[*]Added option to change database path to the config
[*]Added experience points to the shop
[*]Added option to change text size for /shop command
[*]/kit command was improved
[*]Kits may have a description now
[*]Messages are now configurable
[*]Dinos can be spawned using blueprints
[*]/trade command uses character name instead of steam name
[*]Amounts of points given for the time spent on the server can be configured for groups
[*]Some other improvements
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Tribe Log Relay
Resource.message:
[B]General:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Improved timed rewards: It will always pick the highest group amount if possible.
[*]Fixed crash scenarios when unloading
[*]Fixed abuse when using Noglin
[*]Added search feature for shop items
[*]New Global option:  "GiveDinosInCryopods": true, //provides dinos from the /buy command in cryopods
[*]New Global option: "CryoLimitedTime": false //Sets a 60 minute expire time
[*]New Global Function: /shopfind
[/LIST]
Can search and return matching shop items (usage /shopfind searchterm) searches on the Item Key and Descriptions from the ShopItems list
[CODE=json]
"ShopFindCmd": "/shopfind",
"ShopFindUsage": "Usage: /shopfind searchterm",
"ShopFindNotFound": "No items matched your search",
"ShopFindTooManyResults": "Too many results to display refine your search term"
[/CODE]
[LIST]
[*]Added "StackRewards" config. If true player will receive the sum of all the rewards of the groups he's in.
[*]Added "CryoItemPath" under "General". Used to change the cryopod to spawn after purchases (Only change if using custom cryopods mod and it uses the same Custom Item Data as vanilla cryopods)
[/LIST]
[B]Store:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for Permissions
[*]Added Cryopod functionality 
[*]New Store Option:  "SaddleBlueprint": "",
Example: [ICODE]SaddleBlueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'",[/ICODE]
[/LIST]
[B]Kits:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for commands in kits
[*]Added Cryopod functionality
[/LIST]
[B]Message[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New: "RefundError":"Points refunded due to an error" //new message if dino fails to spawn which now refunds the points.
[/LIST]
[B]Discord[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New Discord shop logging integration v.1.0
[/LIST]
[B]Known Issues:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][LEFT]DinoStorage2: Soul Traps is not yet supported as they are using a different mapping[/LEFT]
[/LIST]
[B]Credits:[/B]
Big Thanks to [USER=8785]@Lethal[/USER] [USER=8764]@kalendell[/USER] [USER=3052]@Pelayori[/USER] [USER=48]@Foppa[/USER] for the collaboration work of this release!

Resource.title: Tribe Log Relay
Resource.message:
[B]General:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Improved timed rewards: It will always pick the highest group amount if possible.
[*]Fixed crash scenarios when unloading
[*]Fixed abuse when using Noglin
[*]Added search feature for shop items
[*]New Global option:  "GiveDinosInCryopods": true, //provides dinos from the /buy command in cryopods
[*]New Global option: "CryoLimitedTime": false //Sets a 60 minute expire time
[*]New Global Function: /shopfind
[/LIST]
Can search and return matching shop items (usage /shopfind searchterm) searches on the Item Key and Descriptions from the ShopItems list
[CODE=json]
"ShopFindCmd": "/shopfind",
"ShopFindUsage": "Usage: /shopfind searchterm",
"ShopFindNotFound": "No items matched your search",
"ShopFindTooManyResults": "Too many results to display refine your search term"
[/CODE]
[LIST]
[*]Added "StackRewards" config. If true player will receive the sum of all the rewards of the groups he's in.
[*]Added "CryoItemPath" under "General". Used to change the cryopod to spawn after purchases (Only change if using custom cryopods mod and it uses the same Custom Item Data as vanilla cryopods)
[/LIST]
[B]Store:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for Permissions
[*]Added Cryopod functionality 
[*]New Store Option:  "SaddleBlueprint": "",
Example: [ICODE]SaddleBlueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'",[/ICODE]
[/LIST]
[B]Kits:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for commands in kits
[*]Added Cryopod functionality
[/LIST]
[B]Message[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New: "RefundError":"Points refunded due to an error" //new message if dino fails to spawn which now refunds the points.
[/LIST]
[B]Discord[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New Discord shop logging integration v.1.0
[/LIST]
[B]Known Issues:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][LEFT]DinoStorage2: Soul Traps is not yet supported as they are using a different mapping[/LEFT]
[/LIST]
[B]Credits:[/B]
Big Thanks to [USER=8785]@Lethal[/USER] [USER=8764]@kalendell[/USER] [USER=3052]@Pelayori[/USER] [USER=48]@Foppa[/USER] for the collaboration work of this release!

[*]New Global option: "CryoLimitedTime": false //Sets a 60 minute expire time
[*]New Global Function: /shopfind
[/LIST]
Can search and return matching shop items (usage /shopfind searchterm) searches on the Item Key and Descriptions from the ShopItems list
[CODE=json]
"ShopFindCmd": "/shopfind",
"ShopFindUsage": "Usage: /shopfind searchterm",
"ShopFindNotFound": "No items matched your search",
"ShopFindTooManyResults": "Too many results to display refine your search term"
[/CODE]
[LIST]
[*]Added "StackRewards" config. If true player will receive the sum of all the rewards of the groups he's in.
[*]Added "CryoItemPath" under "General". Used to change the cryopod to spawn after purchases (Only change if using custom cryopods mod and it uses the same Custom Item Data as vanilla cryopods)
[/LIST]
[B]Store:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for Permissions
[*]Added Cryopod functionality 
[*]New Store Option:  "SaddleBlueprint": "",
Example: [ICODE]SaddleBlueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'",[/ICODE]
[/LIST]
[B]Kits:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for commands in kits
[*]Added Cryopod functionality
[/LIST]
[B]Message[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New: "RefundError":"Points refunded due to an error" //new message if dino fails to spawn which now refunds the points.
[/LIST]
[B]Discord[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New Discord shop logging integration v.1.0
[/LIST]
[B]Known Issues:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][LEFT]DinoStorage2: Soul Traps is not yet supported as they are using a different mapping[/LEFT]
[/LIST]
[B]Credits:[/B]
Big Thanks to [USER=8785]@Lethal[/USER] [USER=8764]@kalendell[/USER] [USER=3052]@Pelayori[/USER] [USER=48]@Foppa[/USER] for the collaboration work of this release!

[*]Added "CryoItemPath" under "General". Used to change the cryopod to spawn after purchases (Only change if using custom cryopods mod and it uses the same Custom Item Data as vanilla cryopods)
[/LIST]
[B]Store:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for Permissions
[*]Added Cryopod functionality 
[*]New Store Option:  "SaddleBlueprint": "",
Example: [ICODE]SaddleBlueprint":"Blueprint'/Game/PrimalEarth/CoreBlueprints/Items/Armor/Saddles/PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle.PrimalItemArmor_CarnoSaddle'",[/ICODE]
[/LIST]
[B]Kits:[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Added support for commands in kits
[*]Added Cryopod functionality
[/LIST]
[B]Message[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New: "RefundError":"Points refunded due to an error" //new message if dino fails to spawn which now refunds the points.
[/LIST]
[B]Discord[/B]:
[LIST]
[*]New Discord shop logging integration v.1.0
[/LIST]
[B]Known Issues:[/B]
[LIST]
[*][LEFT]DinoStorage2: Soul Traps is not yet supported as they are using a different mapping[/LEFT]
[/LIST]
[B]Credits:[/B]
Big Thanks to [USER=8785]@Lethal[/USER] [USER=8764]@kalendell[/USER] [USER=3052]@Pelayori[/USER] [USER=48]@Foppa[/USER] for the collaboration work of this release!

Resource.title: ATLAS: Tribe Log Relay
Resource.message:
[LIST]
[*]ArkShopUI support 
[*]Dino Storage V2 support (see "[ICODE]UseSoulTraps[/ICODE]") 
[*]Added [ICODE]-serverkey=UniqueMapName[/ICODE] command line to support running 2 or more of the same map (file logging symlink support) 
[*]Added some default values when pulling data from the config to prevent crashes if they are missing 
[*]Added the ability to specify Damage, Armor, Durability on items. Note: values are not guaranteed if using more than 1 at a time or Quality is set too low.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: [GamingOGs] Lootboxes
Resource.message:
[SIZE=6][B]Introduction[/B][/SIZE]

Adds additional commands to ARK Survival Evolved servers using ARK Server API.

[SIZE=5][B]Chat[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]/MyDinoStats[/B]: Prints the base levels, and optionally base stats, of an owned and tamed dino in-front of the player.
[*][B]/DestroyMyDino[/B]: Deletes the owned and tamed dino in-front of the player from the ARK.
[*][B]/Suicide[/B]: Kill your own character (to get unstuck etc.)
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5][B]Rcon and Console[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]DinoId[/B] Get the dino IDs for the targeted dino (console only).
Example: DinoId


[*][B]DoRespec <steam id>[/B]: Force respec (mindwipe) of a character.
Example: DoRespec 12345678912345678


[*][B]DoRespecDino [<dino_id1> <dino_id2>][/B]: Force respec of a tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]DoRespecDino 123456789 123456789[/B]: Respec the given tamed dino.
[*][B]DoRespecDino[/B]: Respec the targeted tamed dino (console only).
[/LIST]
[*][B]DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition <team id> <x> <y> <radius> <rafts>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team within a given range from a position (optionally including rafts).
Example: DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition 1234567890 85000.0 275000.0 1000 1


[*][B]DestroyDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all tamed dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DroppedEggs <action>[/B]: List or destroy fertilized eggs on the map.
[LIST]
[*][B]DroppedEggs list[/B]: List eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all[/B]: Destroy all eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy all eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]FeedDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Feed all dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: FeedDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]ImprintOn [<steam id>][/B]: Imprint yourself or another player on the targeted tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]ImprintOn[/B]: Imprint on yourself.
[*][B]ImprintOn 12345678912345678[/B]: Imprint on another player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint [reroll [pet, food, walk]][/B]: Immediately unlock the next imprint on the targeted tamed baby dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint[/B]: Unlock next imprint.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll[/B]: Reroll the current imprint and unlock it immediately.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll food[/B]: Reroll the current imprint as feed kibble and unlock it immediately.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Installation[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install ARK Server API ([URL='http://arkserverapi.com/']http://arkserverapi.com[/URL]).
[*]Download and extract ImprovedCommands into ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins.
[*]Optionally configure the plugin in config.json.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Configuration[/B][/SIZE]

In the configuration file config.json you may do the following
[LIST]
[*]Enable/disable individual commands.
[*]Change the name of individual commands.
[*]Enable/disable the ARK Server API permission system for individual chat commands.
[/LIST]

[B]DroppedEggs configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]ClassNames: Type(s) of dropped eggs the command will consider.
[/LIST]

[B]DestroyMyDino configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Method: The method used when destroying a creature (“destroy” or “suicide”).
[/LIST]

[B]MyDinoStats configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)

Resource.title: [GamingOGs] Lootboxes
Resource.message:
[SIZE=6][B]Introduction[/B][/SIZE]

Adds additional commands to ARK Survival Evolved servers using ARK Server API.

[SIZE=5][B]Chat[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]/MyDinoStats[/B]: Prints the base levels, and optionally base stats, of an owned and tamed dino in-front of the player.
[*][B]/DestroyMyDino[/B]: Deletes the owned and tamed dino in-front of the player from the ARK.
[*][B]/Suicide[/B]: Kill your own character (to get unstuck etc.)
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5][B]Rcon and Console[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]DinoId[/B] Get the dino IDs for the targeted dino (console only).
Example: DinoId


[*][B]DoRespec <steam id>[/B]: Force respec (mindwipe) of a character.
Example: DoRespec 12345678912345678


[*][B]DoRespecDino [<dino_id1> <dino_id2>][/B]: Force respec of a tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]DoRespecDino 123456789 123456789[/B]: Respec the given tamed dino.
[*][B]DoRespecDino[/B]: Respec the targeted tamed dino (console only).
[/LIST]
[*][B]DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition <team id> <x> <y> <radius> <rafts>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team within a given range from a position (optionally including rafts).
Example: DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition 1234567890 85000.0 275000.0 1000 1


[*][B]DestroyDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all tamed dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DroppedEggs <action>[/B]: List or destroy fertilized eggs on the map.
[LIST]
[*][B]DroppedEggs list[/B]: List eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all[/B]: Destroy all eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy all eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]FeedDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Feed all dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: FeedDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]ImprintOn [<steam id>][/B]: Imprint yourself or another player on the targeted tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]ImprintOn[/B]: Imprint on yourself.
[*][B]ImprintOn 12345678912345678[/B]: Imprint on another player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint [reroll [pet, food, walk]][/B]: Immediately unlock the next imprint on the targeted tamed baby dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint[/B]: Unlock next imprint.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll[/B]: Reroll the current imprint and unlock it immediately.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll food[/B]: Reroll the current imprint as feed kibble and unlock it immediately.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Installation[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install ARK Server API ([URL='http://arkserverapi.com/']http://arkserverapi.com[/URL]).
[*]Download and extract ImprovedCommands into ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins.
[*]Optionally configure the plugin in config.json.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Configuration[/B][/SIZE]

In the configuration file config.json you may do the following
[LIST]
[*]Enable/disable individual commands.
[*]Change the name of individual commands.
[*]Enable/disable the ARK Server API permission system for individual chat commands.
[/LIST]

[B]DroppedEggs configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]ClassNames: Type(s) of dropped eggs the command will consider.
[/LIST]

[B]DestroyMyDino configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Method: The method used when destroying a creature (“destroy” or “suicide”).
[/LIST]

[B]MyDinoStats configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[*]TamingEfficiencyCalc: Taming Efficiency used in calculation ("current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)

[/LIST]

Resource.title: [GamingOGs] Lootboxes
Resource.message:
[SIZE=6][B]Introduction[/B][/SIZE]

Adds additional commands to ARK Survival Evolved servers using ARK Server API.

[SIZE=5][B]Chat[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]/MyDinoStats[/B]: Prints the base levels, and optionally base stats, of an owned and tamed dino in-front of the player.
[*][B]/DestroyMyDino[/B]: Deletes the owned and tamed dino in-front of the player from the ARK.
[*][B]/Suicide[/B]: Kill your own character (to get unstuck etc.)
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5][B]Rcon and Console[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]DinoId[/B] Get the dino IDs for the targeted dino (console only).
Example: DinoId


[*][B]DoRespec <steam id>[/B]: Force respec (mindwipe) of a character.
Example: DoRespec 12345678912345678


[*][B]DoRespecDino [<dino_id1> <dino_id2>][/B]: Force respec of a tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]DoRespecDino 123456789 123456789[/B]: Respec the given tamed dino.
[*][B]DoRespecDino[/B]: Respec the targeted tamed dino (console only).
[/LIST]
[*][B]DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition <team id> <x> <y> <radius> <rafts>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team within a given range from a position (optionally including rafts).
Example: DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition 1234567890 85000.0 275000.0 1000 1


[*][B]DestroyDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all tamed dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DroppedEggs <action>[/B]: List or destroy fertilized eggs on the map.
[LIST]
[*][B]DroppedEggs list[/B]: List eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all[/B]: Destroy all eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy all eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]FeedDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Feed all dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: FeedDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]ImprintOn [<steam id>][/B]: Imprint yourself or another player on the targeted tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]ImprintOn[/B]: Imprint on yourself.
[*][B]ImprintOn 12345678912345678[/B]: Imprint on another player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint [reroll [pet, food, walk]][/B]: Immediately unlock the next imprint on the targeted tamed baby dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint[/B]: Unlock next imprint.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll[/B]: Reroll the current imprint and unlock it immediately.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll food[/B]: Reroll the current imprint as feed kibble and unlock it immediately.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Installation[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install ARK Server API ([URL='http://arkserverapi.com/']http://arkserverapi.com[/URL]).
[*]Download and extract ImprovedCommands into ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins.
[*]Optionally configure the plugin in config.json.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Configuration[/B][/SIZE]

In the configuration file config.json you may do the following
[LIST]
[*]Enable/disable individual commands.
[*]Change the name of individual commands.
[*]Enable/disable the ARK Server API permission system for individual chat commands.
[/LIST]

[B]DroppedEggs configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]ClassNames: Type(s) of dropped eggs the command will consider.
[/LIST]

[B]DestroyMyDino configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Method: The method used when destroying a creature (“destroy” or “suicide”).
[/LIST]

[B]MyDinoStats configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[*]TamingEfficiencyCalc: Taming Efficiency used in calculation ("current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[*][B]ImprintOn [<steam id>][/B]: Imprint yourself or another player on the targeted tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]ImprintOn[/B]: Imprint on yourself.
[*][B]ImprintOn 12345678912345678[/B]: Imprint on another player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint [reroll [pet, food, walk]][/B]: Immediately unlock the next imprint on the targeted tamed baby dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint[/B]: Unlock next imprint.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll[/B]: Reroll the current imprint and unlock it immediately.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll food[/B]: Reroll the current imprint as feed kibble and unlock it immediately.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Installation[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install ARK Server API ([URL='http://arkserverapi.com/']http://arkserverapi.com[/URL]).
[*]Download and extract ImprovedCommands into ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins.
[*]Optionally configure the plugin in config.json.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Configuration[/B][/SIZE]

In the configuration file config.json you may do the following
[LIST]
[*]Enable/disable individual commands.
[*]Change the name of individual commands.
[*]Enable/disable the ARK Server API permission system for individual chat commands.
[/LIST]

[B]DroppedEggs configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]ClassNames: Type(s) of dropped eggs the command will consider.
[/LIST]

[B]DestroyMyDino configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Method: The method used when destroying a creature (“destroy” or “suicide”).
[/LIST]

[B]MyDinoStats configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[*]TamingEfficiencyCalc: Taming Efficiency used in calculation ("current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

Resource.title: [GamingOGs] Lootboxes
Resource.message:
[SIZE=6][B]Introduction[/B][/SIZE]

Adds additional commands to ARK Survival Evolved servers using ARK Server API.

[SIZE=5][B]Chat[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]/MyDinoStats[/B]: Prints the base levels, and optionally base stats, of an owned and tamed dino in-front of the player.
[*][B]/DestroyMyDino[/B]: Deletes the owned and tamed dino in-front of the player from the ARK.
[*][B]/Suicide[/B]: Kill your own character (to get unstuck etc.)
[/LIST]

[SIZE=5][B]Rcon and Console[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST]
[*][B]DinoId[/B] Get the dino IDs for the targeted dino (console only).
Example: DinoId


[*][B]DoRespec <steam id>[/B]: Force respec (mindwipe) of a character.
Example: DoRespec 12345678912345678


[*][B]DoRespecDino [<dino_id1> <dino_id2>][/B]: Force respec of a tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]DoRespecDino 123456789 123456789[/B]: Respec the given tamed dino.
[*][B]DoRespecDino[/B]: Respec the targeted tamed dino (console only).
[/LIST]
[*][B]DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyAllStructuresForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition <team id> <x> <y> <radius> <rafts>[/B]: Destroys all structures owned by a player or team within a given range from a position (optionally including rafts).
Example: DestroyStructuresForTeamIdAtPosition 1234567890 85000.0 275000.0 1000 1


[*][B]DestroyDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Destroys all tamed dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: DestroyDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]DroppedEggs <action>[/B]: List or destroy fertilized eggs on the map.
[LIST]
[*][B]DroppedEggs list[/B]: List eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_spoiled_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy spoiled eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all[/B]: Destroy all eggs.
[*][B]DroppedEggs destroy_all_including_dropped_by_player[/B]: Destroy all eggs, even ones that have been dropped by a player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]FeedDinosForTeamId <team id>[/B]: Feed all dinos owned by a player or team.
Example: FeedDinosForTeamId 123456789


[*][B]ImprintOn [<steam id>][/B]: Imprint yourself or another player on the targeted tamed dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]ImprintOn[/B]: Imprint on yourself.
[*][B]ImprintOn 12345678912345678[/B]: Imprint on another player.
[/LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint [reroll [pet, food, walk]][/B]: Immediately unlock the next imprint on the targeted tamed baby dino.
[LIST]
[*][B]NextImprint[/B]: Unlock next imprint.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll[/B]: Reroll the current imprint and unlock it immediately.
[*][B]NextImprint reroll food[/B]: Reroll the current imprint as feed kibble and unlock it immediately.
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Installation[/B][/SIZE]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install ARK Server API ([URL='http://arkserverapi.com/']http://arkserverapi.com[/URL]).
[*]Download and extract ImprovedCommands into ShooterGame\Binaries\Win64\ArkApi\Plugins.
[*]Optionally configure the plugin in config.json.
[/LIST]

[SIZE=6][B]Configuration[/B][/SIZE]

In the configuration file config.json you may do the following
[LIST]
[*]Enable/disable individual commands.
[*]Change the name of individual commands.
[*]Enable/disable the ARK Server API permission system for individual chat commands.
[/LIST]

[B]DroppedEggs configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]ClassNames: Type(s) of dropped eggs the command will consider.
[/LIST]

[B]DestroyMyDino configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]Method: The method used when destroying a creature (“destroy” or “suicide”).
[/LIST]

[B]MyDinoStats configuration[/B]
[LIST]
[*]BaseStats
[LIST]
[*]Show: Enable/disable calculation and output of base stats (in addition to base levels).
[*]ImprintCalc: Imprinting quality used in calculation ("none" => 0%, "current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[*]TamingEfficiencyCalc: Taming Efficiency used in calculation ("current" => from dino, "best" => 100%)
[/LIST]
[/LIST]

[*]Search results in notifications + pagination system
[*]Auto map coords detection
[*]More customization (messages, search results)
[*]TokenBank integration
[*]ArkShop integration
[*]Permissions integration 

[B]Note:[/B] This update requires config update!! 

[B]Important:[/B] Due to the time spent fixing and improving this plugin, this will be the last free update containing additional functions. Any functions added after this update will be considered as "Premium" and will require an activation key which can be obtained by purchasing the plugin [U]once the next update is released[/U]. 
Support and bug fixes will still be provided for the free version of the plugin at no additional cost.
[/LIST]

Resource.title: [Discontinued] Performance Logger
Resource.message:
Plugin adds Unicode support to Rcon. This means, you will see real messages instead of "???" symbols after installing it. Keep in mind that not all Rcon clients might support it. This plugin was tested with ARKon.

[B]Installation:[/B]
[LIST=1]
[*]Install [URL='http://arkserverapi.com/resources/ark-server-api.4/']ARK: Server API[/URL]
[*]Copy "UnicodeRcon" folder to "ArkApi/Plugins"
[/LIST]

Resource.title: Kals CrossChat with Discord & Tribes
Resource.message:
[B][U]Kill Feed[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Player Death Feed
[*]Tamed Dino Death Feed
[*]Notifications at top of screen
[*]Can display Weapon Name and Icon
[*]Can display just Weapon Icon
[*]Can display just Weapon Name
[*]Can display in chat box
[*]Can display attackers mounted dino name tag
[/LIST]

[B][U]Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]/kfreload          -        reload config.json at runtime
[/LIST]

[B][U]Config:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]PlayerKillsEnabled          -        displays kill feed for pvp
[*]TamedDinoKillsEnabled          -       display kill feed for tamed dino death
[*]DisplayType        -       change the display message / icon values 0-3
[*]DisplayScale        -      the scale of the notification
[*]DisplayDelay       -      the amount of time to show the feed for
[*]DisplayColour     -      the chat / notification message colour values 0.0 - 1.0
[*]DisplayInChatbox      -      display the killfeed in chatbox
[*]Messages      -      these are the messages used by the plugin you can convert to your own language
[/LIST]

[B][U]DisplayType:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]0 = Display Weapon Icon and Name in Notification
[*]1 = Display Weapon Icon in Notification
[*]2 = Display Weapon Name in Notification
[*]3 = Dont display notification
[/LIST]

[B][U]Donate[/U][/B]
Any donation is much appreciated and very helpful towards the upkeep/creation of the plugins i provide, Plugins take time to create some hours some days and I keep 99% of them open source for others to learn from.

[URL='https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=J6NKDZVCH9RN4&source=url'][IMG]https://www.paypalobjects.com/en_US/GB/i/btn/btn_donateCC_LG.gif[/IMG][/URL]

Resource.title: Kals CrossChat with Discord & Tribes
Resource.message:
[B][U]Kill Feed[/U][/B]

Source: [URL='https://github.com/ownprox/ArkServerApi']Click Here[/URL]

[B][U]Features:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]Player Death Feed
[*]Tamed Dino Death Feed
[*]Notifications at top of screen
[*]Can display Weapon Name and Icon
[*]Can display just Weapon Icon
[*]Can display just Weapon Name
[*]Can display in chat box
[*]Can display attackers mounted dino name tag
[/LIST]

[B][U]Commands:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]/kfreload          -        reload config.json at runtime
[/LIST]

[B][U]Config:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]PlayerKillsEnabled          -        displays kill feed for pvp
[*]TamedDinoKillsEnabled          -       display kill feed for tamed dino death
[*]DisplayType        -       change the display message / icon values 0-3
[*]DisplayScale        -      the scale of the notification
[*]DisplayDelay       -      the amount of time to show the feed for
[*]DisplayColour     -      the chat / notification message colour values 0.0 - 1.0
[*]DisplayInChatbox      -      display the killfeed in chatbox
[*]Messages      -      these are the messages used by the plugin you can convert to your own language
[/LIST]

[B][U]DisplayType:[/U][/B]
[LIST]
[*]0 = Display Weapon Icon and Name in Notification
[*]1 = Display Weapon Icon in Notification
[*]2 = Display Weapon Name in Notification
[*]3 = Dont display notification
[/LIST]

Any donation is much appreciated and very helpful towards the upkeep/creation of the plugins i provide, Plugins take time to create some hours some days and I keep 99% of them open source for others to learn from.
